name: My Hometown: Archives woven into new narrative
description: Offering viewers a snapshot of life on the road for an Australian touring band in the 1960s, 'My Hometown', directed by Sari Braithwaite was developed reimagining archival 8mm footage shot by drummer Leon Isackson.

key_work.title: My Hometown – Munro Melano
key_work.brief_description: When he was just 17-years old, drummer Leon Isackson started capturing his life on the road from 1959 onwards with these clips – shot on 8MM film – combined to capture a nostalgic period of Australian music and form the video for Munro Melano’s ‘My Hometown ‘ (2014).

end.brief_description: A documentary on the life of Amy Winehouse, the immensely talented yet doomed songstress. We see her from her teen years, where she already showed her singing abilities, to her finding success and then her downward spiral into alcoholism and drugs.

end.title: Cameraperson
end.creator_credit: Marilyn Ness, Kirsten Johnson, Fork Films, Big Mouth Productions, Lisa Freedman, Doris Baizley, The Bertha Foundation and Chicken & Egg Pictures
end.brief_description: As a visually radical memoir, CAMERAPERSON draws on the remarkable footage that filmmaker Kirsten Johnson has shot and reframes it in ways that illuminate moments and situations that have personally affected her. What emerges is an elegant meditation on the relationship between truth and the camera frame, as Johnson transforms scenes that have been presented on Festival screens as one kind of truth into another kind of story—one about personal journey, craft, and direct human connection.

constellations_other.description: Fleetwood Mac's 'Dreams' coasted its way back up the charts 40 years after it was first released, thanks to Nathan Apodaca's joyous viral TikTok, but Fleetwood Mac (and Stevie Knicks) have been main staples of screen culture for decades.

links.description: Re-contextualising archival footage, the opening credits for The Americans contrasts and subverts both Soviet and American propaganda from the Cold War era. Superimposed graphics and diagrams further emphasise the impending threat of the lead characters’ hidden sleeper agent identities.
